author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
A separatist-sponsored shutdown paralysed normal life in Kashmir on Thursday as the authorities imposed curfew-like restrictions in parts of Srinagar and north Kashmir to prevent rallies on the 32nd death anniversary of JKLF founder Maqbool Bhat.

Bhat was hanged and buried in Tihar Jail in 1984.

All business centres, offices and banks remained closed in response to the shutdown call issued by several separatist leaders, including Yasin Malik, Syed Ali Shah Geelani and Mirwaiz Umar Farooq.

Areas sealed

There was very thin traffic on the roads. The inter-district train service in the Valley was also suspended. The authorities sealed several areas in Srinagar. Parts of north Kashmir, including Bhat’s village Trehgam, witnessed stringent security restrictions. The separatist JKLF organised programmes in Trehgam, Gilgit-Baltistan and also in the United Kingdom.
title: Kashmir shuts down on Maqbool’s anniversary
